title: Greetings & Introductions
description: Learn basic greetings and how to introduce yourself
descriptionKurdish: فێری سڵاوکردنی بنەڕەتی و ناساندنی خۆت ببە

vocabulary.notes: Used when leaving or ending a conversation
Polite response when meeting someone new

vocabulary.exampleSentence: Good morning! Did you sleep well?
Good evening! How was your day?

exercises.question: How do you greet someone in the morning?
exercises.questionKurdish: چۆن سڵاو لە کەسێک دەکەیت لە بەیانیدا؟
exercises.hint: Think about what time of day it is
exercises.explanation: We use 'Good morning' to greet people before noon.
exercises.explanationKurdish: بەیانی باش بەکاردێت بۆ سڵاوکردن پێش نیوەڕۆ

exercises.question: What does 'Thank you' mean in Kurdish?
exercises.explanation: 'Thank you' means سوپاس - used to show appreciation.
exercises.explanationKurdish: 'Thank you' واتای سوپاسە - بەکاردێت بۆ پیشاندانی سوپاسگوزاری

exercises.question: Complete: My _____ is Ahmed.
exercises.hint: What word do we use to introduce ourselves?
exercises.explanation: We say 'My name is' followed by our name.
exercises.explanationKurdish: ناوم ... ە بەکاردێت بۆ ناساندنی خۆمان

exercises.question: When do we say 'Goodbye'?
exercises.hint: Think about when you're ending a conversation
exercises.explanation: We say 'Goodbye' when we are leaving or ending a conversation.
exercises.explanationKurdish: خواحافیز دەڵێین کاتێک دەڕۆین یان گفتوگۆیەک کۆتایی دێت

exercises.question: What is a polite way to ask for something?
exercises.questionKurdish: شێوەیەکی ڕێزدارانە چییە بۆ داواکردنی شتێک؟
exercises.hint: This word makes requests more polite
exercises.explanation: We use 'Please' to make polite requests.
exercises.explanationKurdish: تکایە بەکاردێت بۆ داواکردنی شتێک بە شێوەیەکی ڕێزدارانە

exercises.question: Nice to _____ you!
exercises.hint: What do you say when meeting someone new?
exercises.explanation: 'Nice to meet you' is what we say when meeting someone for the first time.
exercises.explanationKurdish: خۆشحاڵم بە ناسینت دەڵێین کاتێک بۆ یەکەم جار کەسێک دەناسین

exercises.question: Good _____! (after 6 PM)
exercises.hint: What greeting do we use in the evening?
exercises.explanationKurdish: ئێوارە باش دەڵێین دوای کاتژمێری ٦ ئێوارە

exercises.question: Translate: سوپاس
exercises.explanationKurdish: سوپاس واتای 'Thank you' یە بە ئینگلیزی

exercises.question: Which is correct for introducing yourself?
exercises.explanation: We say 'My name is' followed by our name.
exercises.explanationKurdish: ناوم ... ە دەڵێین و دواتر ناوەکەمان دەڵێین

grammarNotes.title: Personal Pronouns
grammarNotes.content: I, you, he, she, it, we, they
grammarNotes.contentKurdish: من، تۆ، ئەو (نێر)، ئەو (مێ)، ئەوە، ئێمە، ئەوان
examples: You are my friend. (تۆ هاوڕێی منیت)

grammarNotes.title: Verb 'to be' - Present
grammarNotes.content: I am, you are, he/she/it is, we are, they are

culturalNotes.title: Formal vs Informal Greetings
culturalNotes.content: In English, 'Hello' is neutral and can be used in both formal and informal situations. 'Hi' is more casual.
culturalNotes.contentKurdish: لە ئینگلیزیدا، 'Hello' گشتییە و دەتوانرێت لە هەر دوو دۆخی فەرمی و نافەرمیدا بەکاربهێنرێت. 'Hi' زیاتر نافەرمییە.

tips: Practice greetings with friends and family
Try to use these phrases in real conversations
Listen to how native speakers pronounce these words
tipsKurdish: سڵاوەکان لەگەڵ هاوڕێ و خێزان مەشق بکە
هەوڵ بدە ئەم دەربڕینانە لە گفتوگۆی ڕاستەقینەدا بەکاربهێنیت
گوێ لە شێوەی گوتنی قسەکەرە ڕەسەنەکان بگرە
